content.raw:
Make sure that you remove all your previous root installations of gazebo (you can leave the ROS installation installed to /opt/ros/...), i.e. remove everything related to gazebo (gazebo*, gz*, libgazebo*, ... be careful about the gz* though, you might have something installed that's gz* and not related to gazebo) from /usr/shared, /usr/bin, /usr/lib, /usr/local/share, /usr/local/bin, /usr/local/lib. 

Also, how did you install Gazebo? Using the package install or source? 

The problem right now (or at least one of the problems) is that you're running a Gazebo 1.0.2 binary instead of 1.2.x

Btw this is not an actual bug with Gazebo but more of a question of installing Gazebo correctly, please post such questions on answers.gazebosim.org
content.html:
Make sure that you remove all your previous root installations of gazebo (you can leave the ROS installation installed to /opt/ros/...), i.e. remove everything related to gazebo (gazebo, gz, libgazebo, ... be careful about the gz though, you might have something installed that's gz* and not related to gazebo) from /usr/shared, /usr/bin, /usr/lib, /usr/local/share, /usr/local/bin, /usr/local/lib.

Also, how did you install Gazebo? Using the package install or source?

The problem right now (or at least one of the problems) is that you're running a Gazebo 1.0.2 binary instead of 1.2.x

Btw this is not an actual bug with Gazebo but more of a question of installing Gazebo correctly, please post such questions on answers.gazebosim.org
